title: if 2 sw need connect by more than one port , how to  config ?
body:
now,2 sw connect only use one port , if 2 sw need connect by more than one port , how to  config ?

144 159 400Gbps 0.0005ms 0
144 160 400Gbps 0.0005ms 0
144 161 400Gbps 0.0005ms 0
144 162 400Gbps 0.0005ms 0
144 163 400Gbps 0.0005ms 0
author: huangxm0618

comments.body:
> now,2 sw connect only use one port , if 2 sw need connect by more than one port , how to config ?
> 
> 144 159 400Gbps 0.0005ms 0 144 160 400Gbps 0.0005ms 0 144 161 400Gbps 0.0005ms 0 144 162 400Gbps 0.0005ms 0 144 163 400Gbps 0.0005ms 0

1. I don't quite understand the reasoning behind this configuration. Could you provide an example of a similar public topology? (Are you trying to set up a switch with dual uplinks?)
2. Can you simulate your desired scenario by increasing the bandwidth of a specific port?
3. Actually, you can specify multiple links, but that would require modifying the code on the ns3 side. You would need to consider the routing policies in such a scenario.

OK,thanks!
we can use Expand the bandwidth of a single link to simulate!

title: SimAI full simulation how to gen scale_out traffic flows?
body:
if need to gen scale_out traffic ,how to config and gen workload ?  
please give an example , as gpt-7B megtron ....
author: huangxm0618

comments.body:
> if need to gen scale_out traffic ,how to config and gen workload ? please give an example , as gpt-7B megtron ....

In the example, the workload demonstrates scale-out traffic. Normally, any multi-nodes training scenario would involve scale-out traffic, be it TP, EP, or DP, and so on.
but, I use 7B,22B,175B workload to simulation, only see the traffic in nodes（scale_up），can not see the scale-out traffic

> but, I use 7B,22B,175B workload to simulation, only see the traffic in nodes（scale_up），can not see the scale-out traffic

How did you arrive at the conclusion that "can not see the scale-out traffic"? The third column in the first row of the workload, 'grad_gather/grad_param_comm', represents the DP communication, which is generally inter-machine communication.

i see in getflowmodels src/dest ，the Difference between src and  dst No more than 8 。 Whether this view is wrong？

---

grad_gather can see scale_out traffic
